citation.article-title: Flexistipes sinusarabici, a novel genus and species of eubacteria occurring in the Atlantis II Deep brines of the Red Sea

p.s: Description of Flexistipes sinusarabici, Fiala, Woese, Langworthy and Stetter, sp. nov.
Flexistipes sinusarabici (sinus.a.ra'bi.ci L. masc. g. sinus gulf; L. masc. adj. arabicus arabic; L. masc. g. sinusarabici of the Red Sea; describing the place of isolation)
About 0.3 μm in width and 5 to 50 μm in length.
Growth between 30° and 53°C, pH 6 to 8, and at least 3% NaCl.
Shortest doubling time 8.5 h under optimal conditions.
Heterotrophic growth on yeast extract, meat extract, peptone, and tryptone.
Weak growth on acetate and casamino acids.
Sensitive to penicillin, ampicillin, vacomycin, and streptomycin.
Lipids contain C16-Ca18 fatty acids as principal compounds. 39 mol% GC.
Occurs in the Atlantis II Deep brines of the Red Sea (water depth: 2000 m).
Type strain in Flexistipes sinusarabici, MAS 10, DSM 4947, Braunschweig, FRG.
